timeline.bodyText: I feel like canExplode should be renamed because it's actual value dictates whether the event is cancelled, so it's really more can't explode than can. Either that or the value should be inverted so canExplode returns false if the event should be cancelled.
timeline.author: silverwolfg11
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,91 @@ +package com.palmergames.bukkit.towny.event.actions; + +import org.bukkit.Location; +import org.bukkit.entity.Entity; +import org.bukkit.event.Cancellable; +import org.bukkit.event.Event; +import org.bukkit.event.HandlerList; +import org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent.DamageCause; + +/** + * Part of the API which lets Towny's war and other plugins modify Towny's + * plot-permission-decision outcomes. + * + * TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvents are thrown when an explosion + * occurs in a Towny world, causing damage to an entity. + * + *
- When an entity explosion, block explosion or lightning damages an entity. + *
- When an explosion would damage a Hanging entity. + *
- When a pig is zapped by lightning. + *
- When an explosion would damage a Vehicle. + * + * @param location - Location of the entity being damaged. + * @param entity - Entity getting exploded. + * @param cause - DamageCause. + * @param canExplode - Whether Towny will cancel this already. + * + * @author LlmDl + */ +public class TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvent extends Event implements Cancellable { + + private static final HandlerList handlers = new HandlerList(); + private final Location location; + private final Entity entity; + private final DamageCause cause; + private boolean canExplode; + + /** + * Event thrown when an explosion damages an entity. + * Use ignorecancelled = true in order to filter out explosions Towny will already have stopped. + * + * @param location - Location of the entity being damaged. + * @param harmedEntity - Entity getting exploded. + * @param cause - DamageCause. + * @param canExplode - Whether Towny will cancel this already.

timeline.bodyText: This should be an else if otherwise if isExpl is off, then it will override isForceExpl
timeline.author: silverwolfg11

timeline.bodyText: If town explosions are enabled, do all townblocks in the town force toggle the explosion perm for the townblock?
timeline.author: silverwolfg11

replies.bodyText: Town explosions enabling should enable them on all non-changed townblocks. So it will be a per-plot setting.
replies.author: LlmDl

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick, but maybe should be called Blocks event instead of Block event since it's more than one block.
timeline.author: silverwolfg11
silverwolfg11
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,91 @@ +package com.palmergames.bukkit.towny.event.actions; + +import org.bukkit.Location; +import org.bukkit.entity.Entity; +import org.bukkit.event.Cancellable; +import org.bukkit.event.Event; +import org.bukkit.event.HandlerList; +import org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent.DamageCause; + +/** + * Part of the API which lets Towny's war and other plugins modify Towny's + * plot-permission-decision outcomes. + * + * TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvents are thrown when an explosion + * occurs in a Towny world, causing damage to an entity. + * + *
- When an entity explosion, block explosion or lightning damages an entity. + *
- When an explosion would damage a Hanging entity. + *
- When a pig is zapped by lightning. + *
- When an explosion would damage a Vehicle. + * + * @param location - Location of the entity being damaged. + * @param entity - Entity getting exploded. + * @param cause - DamageCause. + * @param canExplode - Whether Towny will cancel this already.

timeline.message:
TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Adds TownyExplodeEvent(Location location, boolean canExplode)
- Used via the TownyActionEventExecutor in the Listener classes to
decide the outcome of an explosion.
- Deletes the ExplosionUtil.
- Separates the war explosion tests, moving them into the
WarZoneListener, where the TownyExplodeEvent outcome is altered if
needed.


TODO: Work out some way of allowing for Block Damage and Entity Damage to be separated from each other so that wars can have TNT that hurts entities but does not destroy the terrain. Potentially two events needed.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- First draft at a block/entity damage split.
- Currently has a delay and block passed on in order to allow for things
like the revert-on-explosions-in-warzones. It's messy.
- Also currently has a number of entities being tested like they are
blocks (hangingentities and vehicles) which I'm not entirely sure of
yet.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Undo last commit's change that would make some explosions' checks into
Block damage instead of Entity damage tests.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Changes events into TownyExplodingBlockEvent &
TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvent.
  - BlockEvent uses filterable list of Blocks which will then determine
what is allowed to explode.
  - EntityEvent uses location and entity involved.
- Wither explosion in EntityListener's EntityChangeBlockEvent is the
only exception (not sure what to do with this one, exactly) and just
uses a canExplode(Location) test.
- WarZoneListener has been altered to use the new setup.
- New system is better than before but probably still not ready.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Adds TownyExplosionEvent which tests only for a location.
  - Currently only used for Wither explosions.
- Adds javadoc comments explaining when the new explosion events are
being called.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Do away with the TownyExplosionEvent.
  - Unneeded as Withers did not need to have their explosions cancelled
in the EntityChangeBlockEvent, they throw EntityExplodeEvents.
- Remove wither section from the EntityChangeBlockEvent in
TownyEntityListener.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Fix javadoc and whitespacing.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Adds DamageCause to TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvent.
- Adds Material and Entity to TownyExplodingBlockEvent.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Make silverwolf's requested changes.

TownyExplodeEvent commit.

- Fix TownyExplosionDamagesEntityEvent being given the opposite of
cancelled.
